column1: File: Create Gallery: Creating a gallery is possible when more than 4000 picture is opened in the window
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 application
 # Open an image folder that has more than 4000 pictures by clicking on the File the Folder
 # After fetching Click on the file then Click on Create Gallery
 # Click on Create 
 # Then click on Ok
 # Opened the create folder and count the pictures

*Actual Result:* Creating a gallery is possible when more than 4000 picture is opened in the window.

*Expected Result:* The window can open only 4000 pictures at a time. The gallery should be created less or equal to 4000 pictures.
column35: 04/Aug/23 10:45 PM;m.foysal;4000+ images are opened in the window.mp4;https://jira.a1qa.com/secure/attachment/2392792/4000%2B+images+are+opened+in+the+window.mp4

column1: Title Bar: The title bar background color is the same as the window color
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 application
 # Observed the title bar color and window color

*Actual Result:* The title bar background color is the same as the window color

*Expected Result:* The title bar color should be different from the window color

column1: Options: Language: Only the options dialog language is changed when the application language is changed
column25:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 application
 # Click on Options
 # Click on the language slide-down arrow
 # Click on Deutsch
 # Click on apply
 # Close the application and then open the application
 # Observed the window language and all options language

*Actual Result:* Only the options dialog language is changed when the application language is changed

*Expected Result:* Whole application language should be changed with all options.

column1: Kimba 2: No confirmation message is displayed when closing the application by clicking on the cross  button
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the application
 # Open an image folder by clicking on the file then folder
 # After fetching apply some changes in the displayed picture
 # Click on the cross button from the top right title bar
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:* No confirmation message is displayed when closing the application by clicking on the cross  button

*Expected Result:* A confirmation message window should be displayed when apply some changes and close the window. A confirmation message like " Are you sure to close the window"  there should be two buttons "Save and close" and "close without save"
column35: 04/Aug/23 7:47 PM;m.foysal;without popup mesage its close the window.mp4;https://jira.a1qa.com/secure/attachment/2392728/without+popup+mesage+its+close+the+window.mp4

column1: File: Folder: The total selected image number is not displayed when one or more image is select
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 application
 # Open an image folder by clicking on the file then folder
 # After fetching select some image randomly by press on ctrl and right key
 # Observed the window 
 # There is no total  selected  number 

*Actual Result:* The total selected image number is not displayed when one or more image is select

*Expected Result:* The total number of selected images should be displayed at the bottom of the left-side window

column1: Edit: Select as Cover: The selected picture doesn't display a visual marked with a border when select as cover
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 application
 # Open an image folder by clicking on the file then folder
 # After fetching select a picture
 # Click on Edit then Click on Select as Cover
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:* The selected picture doesn't display a visual marked with a border when select as cover

*Expected Result:* The selected picture should be displayed a visual marked with a border then select as cover

column1: Kimba 2: Menu Bar: The menu items bar is displayed without the vertical bar when opening the application
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 application
 # Observed the menu items
 # There is no vertical bar in the middle of the two items

*Actual Result:* The menu items bar is displayed without the vertical bar when opening the application

{*}Expected Result{*}: The menu items bar should be displayed with the vertical bar in the middle of the two items

column1: File: Create Gallery: Thumbnails picture display size is large than the Big picture when creating a gallery
column25:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 application
 # Open an image folder by clicking on file then folder
 # After fetching Click on file then Create Gallery
 # Go to the Create kimba folder
 # Observed the Big and Thumbnails picture

*Actual Result:* Thumbnails picture display size is large than the Big picture when creating a gallery

*Expected Result:* The thumbnail picture display size should be small than the Big picture display size.

column1: File: Create Gallery: Auto optimize option is not applied any changes when a gallery is created
column25:
*Steps to reproduce*
 # Open Kimba 2 application
 # Open a folder by clicking on file then click on folder
 # After images fetching click on file then create gallery
 # Then click on Create 
 # Then Click on Ok 
 # Observed the file size and images
 # Then click on file and then click on create folder 
 # Checked the auto-optimized check box
 # then Steps 4 to 5
 # Observed the Image 

*Actual Result:* Auto optimize option is not applied any changes when a gallery is created

*Expected Result:* Auto optimized option should enhance the color, sharpness and brightness.

column1: Edit: Delete: All picture changes are reset when an picture is deleted from the window
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open Kimba 2 application
 # Open an image folder by clicking on the file then folder
 # Apply some changes in the displayed picture like Rotate, Flip
 # Select an image then delete it from the Edit options
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:* All picture changes are reset when an picture is deleted from the window

*Expected Result:* All picture changes should be the same when a picture is deleted

*Additional Information:* When large size image folder is opened and delete an image only 2/4 pictures are displayed after deletion.
column35: 04/Aug/23 4:10 PM;m.foysal;after deletation only two or four picture are displayed.mp4;https://jira.a1qa.com/secure/attachment/2392499/after+deletation+only+two+or+four+picture+are+displayed.mp4

column1: Edit: Rotate Left: The Rotate left function is not working when large size picture folder is opened
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open Kimba 2 aplication
 # Open an image folder that has large resolution image and a total size of more than 92MB
 # Select an picture then Click on Edit
 # Click on Rotate left 
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:* The Rotate left function is not working when large size picture folder is opened

*Expected Result:* The Rotate left function should be rotated left the picture

*Additional Information:* This issue is the same for the Rotate Right, Flip Vertical, Flip Horizontal, and Optimized buttons.

column1: File: Folder: All images are not displayed when a folder open with large size picture
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 application
 # Open an image folder by clicking on the file then the folder
 # Observed the displayed image
 # Observed the folder all image
 # Some images are not displayed

*Actual Result:* All images are not displayed when a folder open with large size picture

*Expected Result:* All images should be displayed when a folder opens.

*Additional Information:* This issue happens when a folder has high-resolution and low-resolution mixed pictures all low-resolution and some high-resolution pictures are opened up to 92MB.

column1: Uninstallation: Options: Options dialog value are not reset when uninstalling and reinstalling the application
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the kimba 2 application
 # Click on options
 # Changes the default value
 # Click on Apply
 # Uninstalled the application
 # Reinstalled the application
 # Then again Steps 1 and 2
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:* Options dialog value are not reset when uninstalling and reinstalling the application

*Expected Result:* Options dialog value should be reset and displayed default value when uninstalled and reinstalled.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 application
 # Open an image folder by Clicking file then folder
 # Observed the window

*Actual Result:* Larger than 5MB size pictures are displayed in the window when a picture folder is opened

column1: File: Folder: Some blank image grid is displayed when maximize the window
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 applications
 # Open an image folder from file then click on folder
 # Wait for load 9 or 10 picture
 # Expand the window
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:* Some blank image grid is displayed when maximizing the window

*Expected Result:*  All image grids should be filled by opened picture

column1: File: Folder: Adding some pictures to the existing folder and when refreshing the window it doesn't display all photos
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 applications
 # Open an image folder by clicking on the file then folder options
 # Add some pictures in the opened folder
 # Click on file then click on Refresh
 # Observed the result:

*Actual Result:* Adding some pictures to the existing folder and when refreshing the window it doesn't display all photos

*Expected Result:* Added all pictures should be displayed after the previously displayed picture

{*}Additional Information{*}: When some picture is added in the folder then refresh the window  previously displayed pictures are missing from the window

column1: File: Folder: Current folder Images are not displayed correctly when existing folder images are displayed
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open Kimba 2 application
 # Open an Image folder by clicking on file then folder
 # Wait until show ready
 # Open another image Folder by clicking on file then Folder
 # Observed the Result

*Actual Result:* Current folder Images are not displayed correctly when existing folder images are displayed

*Expected Result:* The current folder image should be displayed properly.

*Additional information:* When a folder is open and try to reopen this folder only 2/4 image is displayed. sometimes it displayed an empty window.

column1: Edit: Optimize: Changes are not displayed in the main window when some change is applied in the optimize window
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open Kimba 2 application
 # Open an Image folder
 # Select an image then Click on Edit
 # Click on optimize
 # Rotate left or right 
 # Click on apply
 # Observed the image

*Actual Result:* Changes are not displayed in the main window when some change is applied in the optimize window

*Expected Result:* Changes should be displayed in the main window when some change is applied in the optimized window

*Additional Information:*  When a image is opened in the optimized window doing some changes but not click on apply then close the window and then reopen the image. The image is displayed in changes mode not is actual mode.

column1: Edit: Optimize: The first selected image is not displayed in the optimize window when more than one picture is selected
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 applications
 # Open an image folder
 # Select more than one picture
 # Click on Edit then click on optimize
 # Observed the displayed image 
 # Observed the optimized window

*Actual Result:* The first selected image is not displayed in the optimize window when more than one picture is selected

*Expected Result:* The first selected image should be displayed in the optimized window

*Additional Information:* When more than one picture is opened in the optimized window there should be a button "Apply to all ( selected like 4,10) picture".

column1: Edit: Optimize: The sharpness slider is disabled when the optimize window is opened
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 applications
 # Open an image folder
 # Select a image
 # Click on Edit then click on optimize
 # Try to move the sharpness slider
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:* The sharpness slider is disabled when the optimize window is opened

*Expected Result:* The sharpness slider should be movable or functional

*Additional Information:* This issue is the same for Brightness and Contrast slider.

column1: Edit: Optimize: The auto-optimize button is disabled when opening the optimize window
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 application
 # Open a folder with image
 # Select a image
 # Click on Edit then Click on optimized
 # Observed the optimized window
 # Auto Optimize button is disabled

*Actual Result:* The auto-optimize button is disabled when opening the optimize window

*Expected Result:* The auto-optimized button should be active when an image is opened in  the optimized window.

*Additional Information:* "Red -Eye Reduction" button is also disabled in the optimize window

column1: Edit: "Auto optimize all picture" option is missing when clicking on the edit menu item

column1: Options: The options dialog is displayed different height and width pixels than the requirement size when clicking on it
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba 2 applications
 # Click on the options
 # Observed the dialog pixels' height and width

*Actual Result:* The options dialog is displayed different height and width pixels than the requirement size when clicking on it

*Expected Result:* The Thumbnails size 170*127 px, Big pic size 640*480px, Cover pic size 130*120px  should be displayed by default

column1: Files: Create Gallery: A folder is created instead of a zip file when clicking on Create Gallery
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the kimba 2 applications
 # Open a image folder 
 # Click on Create Gallery
 # Click on Create then click on ok
 # Check the create file
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:* A folder is created instead of a zip file when clicking on Create Gallery

*Expected Result:* A zip file should be created when clicking on the create gallery

*Additional Information:* When unzip the file it's contain three folder 1.Cover 2.Thumbs 3.Big. 

In the cover folder, the cover photo should be displayed when opened it. Thumbs folder all the small images should be displayed and in the Big folder all the big images should be displayed.

column1: Files: Create Gallery: The folder is created in the apps installed directory instead of the current image folder when clicking on "Create  gallery"
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open kimba 2 application
 # Click on File then click on folder
 # Select a image folder and open it
 # After fetching the images click on File then click on Create gallery
 # Then click on Create
 # Then Click on Ok
 # Go to the Installed drive find Kimba 
 # Open the folder and observed the result

*Actual Result:* The folder is created in the apps installed directory instead of the current image folder when clicking on "Create  gallery"

*Expected Result:* The zip folder "Current directory/kimba.zip" should be created in the Opening image folder

column1: Kimba 2: No toolbar is displayed below the menu items when the  application is opened
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the kimba 2 application
 # Observed the menu items and 
 # There is no toolbar below the menu items

*Actual Result:* No toolbar is displayed below the menu items when the  application is opened

*Expected Result:* The toolbar should be displayed below  the menu items when the application is opened

column1: Uninstallation: During removing process 'Installation is complete' is displayed instead of 'Removing is complete'
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the kimba setup file
 # Double-click on kimba2install.msi
 # Click on remove and the click on the Finished button
 # Click on Yes
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:* During removing a window is displayed installation is complete instead of removing is complete

*Expected Result:* The window should be displayed removing or uninstalling the application is complete

column1: Uninstallation: Installation: The application is displayed the previous open folder images instead of the empty window when opening the application after reinstalling
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Open the Kimba application
 # Open a folder with images from file menu items
 # After fetching the image close the window
 # Uninstalled the application
 # Reinstalled the application
 # Open the application
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:* The application is displayed the previous open folder images instead of the empty window when opening the application after reinstalling

*Expected result:* The application window should display empty when opening the application after reinstalling

column1: Uninstallation: "KWICK!" folder is displayed  when the application uninstallation is finished
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Installed kimba2 application successfully
 # Open kimba2 application from windows search bar
 # open control panel uninstall a program
 # Select kimba application right click on it
 # click on uninstall
 # click on do not close the application 
 # Click on Ok 
 # Go to the C dive and program file x86 click on it
 # There is a KWICK! folder 
 # Open the folder and observed the result

*Actual Result:* "KWICK!" folder is displayed  when the application uninstallation is finished

*Expected Result:* The folder should be removed when the application is uninstalled

column1: Uninstallation: The open window appears even after uninstalling the application
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Installed the kimba2 application
 # Open this application from windows search bar
 # Go to control Panel
 # Go to programs 
 # Go to uninstall a programs
 # Right click on kimba and select uninstall
 # Click on Ok
 # Select do not close the application
 # Then click ok
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:* The open window appears even after uninstalling the application

*Expected Result:* The open window should be closed and then uninstalled the applications

*Expected Result:* The application window should be responsive when maximize and minimize the the window

column1: Installation:  There is no window for license permission when installing the application
column25:
*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Double-click on "Kimba2install.msi
 # Click on next
 # Select Everyone radio button
 # Click on next
 # Click on next
 # Click on administrator permission yes
 # Click on Close
 # Observed the result

*Actual Result:*  Installation time there is no window for license permission when clicking on all window next button 

*Expected Result:* Installation time there should be a license window with all valid information with two check box.
